questions.question:
What is the output of the following program?

int add(int a, int b) {
    return a + b;
}

double add(double a, double b) {
    return a + b;
}

int main() {
    cout << add(5, 3) << ";";
    cout << add(4.2, 2.7);
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following code?

int x = 0;
while (x < 5) {
    cout << x << " ";
    x++;
}
cout << x;
return 0;

Given the following code, what will be the value of "result"?

int a = 5, b = 3;
int result = a % b;

What is the purpose of a class template in C++?

(A) To define an instance of a class.
(B) To create objects of a class.
(C) To create a blueprint for multiple classes.
(D) To create a generic class that works with different data types.

options.A: To define an instance of a class.
options.B: To create objects of a class.
options.C: To create a blueprint for multiple classes.
options.D: To create a generic class that works with different data types.

questions.question:
What is the output of the following code?

void printValues(int x, int y) {
    cout << "int: " << x << ", " << y << endl;
}

void printValues(double a, double b) {
    cout << "double: " << a << ", " << b << endl;
}

int main() {
    printValues(5, 3.5);
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

int x = 10;
int main() {
    int x = 20;
    {
        int x = 30;
        cout << x << " ";
    }
    cout << x;
    return 0;
}

What is the correct way to declare a class template in C++?

(A) template  class MyClass { ... }
(B) class MyClass { ... }
(C) class  MyClass { ... }
(D) template  class MyClass { ... }

What does the following code snippet do?

struct Point {
    int x;
    int y;
}

Point p1 = {3, 4};
Point p2 = p1;

options.A: It defines a class called Point.
options.B: It creates two Point objects and initializes them.
options.C: It calculates the distance between two points.
options.D: It swaps the values of p1 and p2.

questions.question:
What is the output of the following code?

class MyClass {
public:
    MyClass() {
        cout << "Constructor ";
    }

    ~MyClass() {
        cout << "Destructor ";
    }
}

int main() {
    MyClass obj;
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

int num = 10;
do {
    cout << num << " ";
} while (num-- > 0);

What is the purpose of a constructor in C++?

(A) To destroy objects.
(B) To allocate memory.
(C) To initialize objects.
(D) To define member functions.

Given the following code, what is the value of "x" after the loop?

int x = 0;
while (x < 5) {
    x++;
}

What is the output of the following program?

template 
T max(T a, T b) {
    return a > b ? a : b;
}

int main() {
    int result = max(3, 7);
    cout << result;
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

int num = 5;
while (num > 0) {
    cout << num-- << " ";
}

What is the output of the following program?

int x = 10;
do {
    cout << x;
} while (x--);

What is the purpose of the destructor in C++?

(A) To create objects.
(B) To initialize objects.
(C) To perform cleanup or resource deallocation.
(D) To access member functions.

options.C: To perform cleanup or resource deallocation.

questions.question:
Given the following code, what is the value of "y" after the loop?

int y = 5;
do {
    y--;
} while (y > 0);

What is the output of the following code?

class MyClass {
public:
    MyClass() {
        cout << "A";
    }
}

int main() {
    MyClass obj[3];
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

int x = 0;
do {
    cout << x;
} while (++x < 5);

What is the output of the following code?

int num = 3;
do {
    cout << num * 2 << " ";
} while (num-- > 0);
